> Eat corpse supposedly works.  Resurrect works.

You cast it on the shield?

> With a one player team, cycling through undoes the effect 

Hmm...

> Hehe.  "Tic and Tac" is the hardest level by far in my book.  It's 
> because the experience levels of those opponents are so high.

This level is pretty easy so long as you make the elves fight 
Jakarta's men.  If you try to brute force it, it's a real meat 
grinder.  I suppose with a large army you can't control your men well 
enough to hold back, though.

> At least now you can download a version of Gladiator:Beyond 
Freedom.  
> visit http://groups.yahoo.com/group/gladiator/files/Alpa/ to 
download 
> the files for that program.

This is the same alpha that's been around on the FSGames site for a 
while, right?  I remember finding it unplayable -- doesn't it run 
super fast or something?
  
> No.  We had a pretty good discussion a while back about adding new 
> abilites to characters and expanding character classes.

That's too bad.
  
> I would recommend to try the tevfifty first.  After that, 
> try mine (dph's scenarios).

Do these start on Level 1, or are they "play after you beat the 
game" -- by level 1 I mean troops @ level 1, not scenario 1.
 
> We're also working on getting a gladiator tournament ready.

?  How would that work?

How many people still subscribe to this list, btw?
